intro: Pseudolinosyris sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis's pseudolinosyris, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with rich, humus-filled soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
